data.title: Netflix announces ten-for-one stock split, shares rise
data.description:
(Reuters) -Netflix on Thursday announced a ten-for-one stock split, making the streaming company's shares more affordable for retail investors.

The company said it would issue nine additional shares for each share held after close of trading on Nov 10, adding that the split will make its stock more accessible to employees participating in its stock option program.

Trading is expected to begin on a split-adjusted basis at the market open on November 17.

The streaming giant, which has benefited from a strong line-up of shows, including the recent success of the animated "KPop Demon Hunters", currently has a market capitalization of $461.44 billion, as of Thursday's close.

Its shares have risen more than 360% over the past three years, far outpacing media rivals Walt Disney and Comcast . The stock was up about 3% at $1,123.49 in extended trading.

This marks Netflix's third stock split since it went public in 2002, with the last one in 2019 that reduced the company's per-share price to about $100 from $700.

"A split will make it easier for small investors to buy in but it doesn't change anything about the company or its attractiveness to institutional investors who drive the market," said Ross Benes, senior analyst at EMarketer.

Netflix's forward price-to-earnings multiple (P/E), a common benchmark for valuing stocks, is 45.96, compared with Walt Disney's 17.54 and Comcast's 6.89.

(Reporting by Juveria Tabassum in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

data.title: Suning.com Co., Ltd. Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Suning.com Co., Ltd. reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 38,131.1 million compared to CNY 38,022.34 million a year ago. Net income was CNY 73.33 million compared to CNY 599.22 million a year ago.

Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.0081 compared to CNY 0.0657 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.0081 compared to CNY 0.0657 a year ago.

data.title: Mphasis Limited Reports Earnings Results for the Second Quarter and Six Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Mphasis Limited reported earnings results for the second quarter and six months ended September 30, 2025. For the second quarter, the company reported sales was INR 39,019.11 million compared to INR 35,361.46 million a year ago. Revenue was INR 39,765.54 million compared to INR 35,948.96 million a year ago. Net income was INR 4,690.74 million compared to INR 4,233.32 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 24.65 compared to INR 22.38 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 24.54 compared to INR 22.18 a year ago.
For the six months, sales was INR 76,344 million compared to INR 69,586.08 million a year ago. Revenue was INR 77,899.91 million compared to INR 70,909.03 million a year ago. Net income was INR 9,107.77 million compared to INR 8,278.4 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 47.87 compared to INR 43.78 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was INR 47.67 compared to INR 43.43 a year ago.

data.title: Tranche Update on Comcast Corporation's Equity Buyback Plan announced on February 15, 2012.
data.description: From July 1, 2025 to September 30, 2025, the company has repurchased 46,014,962 shares, representing 1.24% for $1,540.95 million. With this, the company has completed the repurchase of 1,723,007,749 shares, representing 38.97% for $72,901.24 million under the buyback announced on February 15, 2012.
